intro: Lytoneuron rufum, commonly known as the red-veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes other nettle species known for their stinging hairs. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with distinctive reddish veins and produces small, greenish flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. The plant's botanical characteristics make it identifiable by its unique leaf venation and overall appearance.
